content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
- Total blocks: 7 blocks
- Number of layers: 4 layers

## Spatial Relationships
- Layer 1 (Bottom): Two cube blocks side by side - a blue cube on the left and a yellow cube on the right
- Layer 2 (Second from bottom): Two cube blocks side by side - a red cube on the left and an orange cube on the right
- Layer 3 (Third from bottom): One green rectangular block placed horizontally across the two blocks below it
- Layer 4 (Top): Two cube blocks stacked vertically - a blue cube on the bottom and a red cube on top

# Selection of Required Blocks

Based on my analysis, I need the following blocks from the dictionary:
- Blue cube (index 1) - appears twice in the structure
- Yellow cube (index 5) - appears once in the structure
- Red cube (index 4) - appears twice in the structure
- Orange cube (index 3) - appears once in the structure
- Green rectangular block in horizontal orientation (index 6) - appears once in the structure

# Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 5
   Step3: Move block with index 4
   Step4: Move block with index 3
   Step5: Move block with index 6
   Step6: Move block with index 1
   Step7: Move block with index 4
}
```

This assembly sequence starts from the bottom layer and progresses upward, placing the blocks in a stable configuration to form the target structure.
